metadata.title: CVE-2014-8350 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Smarty before 3.1.21 allows remote attackers to bypass the secure moderestrictions and execute arbitrary PHP code as demonstrated by"{literal}<{/literal}script language=php>" in a template.

criterions.comment: smarty3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
